website_summaries.verdict: This is the perfect compact drill for light-duty work, and the base is compatible with several other BLACK+DECKER tool attachments.
pros: Quick Connect system enables you to quickly change out the drill head for other tool attachments
11-position clutch gives you more control while you drill
Top-notch quality for the price range
cons: This drill may not be powerful enough to handle extended heavy-duty work

customer_reviews.title: I love the concept though
customer_reviews.text: AH I don't know why I keep torturing myself with these black and decker drills. I purchased the regular non-matrix one and the chuck froze up after only three months. So I figured I'd try the upgrade this time and bought the Matrix. Same problem. After a few months totally frozen. I've tried everything under the google sun, and nothing will unfreeze it. Major design flaw. I love the concept though. I have the circle saw attachment and it works decently well. But a replacement drill attachment is almost the same price as the drill itself. I wish the manufacturer would do something to remedy.
customer_reviews.author: Love Always...Mandy

customer_reviews.title: does not hold up to torque for long, my motor burned up.
customer_reviews.text: i really do like the drill i just want to put the heads up out there that this drill does not handle torque well, motor burned up after a few projects that required some torque, literally after 2 projects, i was using plenty of cutting oil drilling a hole with a bi-metal hole saw, taking it nice and easy using the lower trigger speed and the motor burned up. May not be a problem for most, but just to let people know, this drill is not going to hold up to any thing high torque for very long.
customer_reviews.author: random spaz 219

customer_reviews.title: ... and with so much power for the price very easy to use and figure out for a newbie
customer_reviews.text: My very first drill and with so much power for the price very easy to use and figure out for a newbie.I will definitely purchase this drill driver again.
customer_reviews.author: Fangirl

customer_reviews.title: Frozen chuck
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to like it, but it arrived with the chuck so tight that I couldn't unscrew it, and was unable to use the tool. Looking at review the problem happened to lot of people. Update, ordered a 2nd one, same problem, frozen chuck.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Cal

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Tired of cordless drills
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Tired of cordless drills. They say Lithium lasts forever (not really but they come close to making that claim), but in reality those batteries are finicky. They can't be left in the garage or the cold will kill the battery. Gotta let the battery drain completely before recharging or you "condition" the battery and reduce its storage capacity. Whatever. Just give me a plug and let's go. Extension cords are easy to find and you never have to worry about the drill dying in the middle of a job. Haven't purchased the other attachments so I don't know how good they are.
customer_reviews.author: ANTOINE V SIMMONS

customer_reviews.title: B+D Drill
customer_reviews.text: I have the cordless one with some attachments. I've notice that using the circular saw, the batteries drain very quickly. (Not because of using a saw, but because of the time It remains working). The corded one is stronger, so it's more apropiate when circular and other saws are used (if you have an AC outlet around). I will keep using the cordless one on difficult to reach sites, screwing and light drilling.
customer_reviews.author: RCarranza

customer_reviews.title: True believer so far
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly capable, and feels like any other drill. The Matrix system is astonishingly good, allowing a simple small tool bag to carry a shops worth of common hand tools. This drilled in my Tapcon screws into concrete for a new floor, and the cip saw attachment helped demo my kitchen. It even handled mixing quickcrete with a drill-mixer-bit. Very impressed, especially at this price. What do I want to see next? A "pro" version in brushless that has a 20v battery AND can switch to run on AC power.
customer_reviews.author: D. Engel

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: it’s the only corded clutch drill could find, but was pleasantly surprised. am so done dealing with less dependable rechargeable drills, to much hassle. great quality for price and ended up adding some attachments wich is really efficient for home shop. can’t speak to extended life yet,y guess with the heavy use i give one, might get 1-2 years out it, who l led maybe longer ? but heck it performs well so would be happy to buy one every other year vs a lesser performing and more expense alternative
customer_reviews.author: TexasShipAgent

customer_reviews.title: We shall see.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this once, so I don't have an accurate review. I bought it because I wanted a corded version of the Matrix/Bolt-On since I have almost all of the attachments. The battery operated versions seem to have issues...the Bolt-On fried the switch and the Matrix fried the motor...that motor was within 2 months of purchasing. As for this corded version, I hope it will last longer than the cordless did. I prefer cordless for some projects...not close to an outlet...and corded for others...more torque, more run time.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff C.

customer_reviews.title: Biggest piece of s*!& ever
customer_reviews.text: Giving this a one star is giving it to much credit. This is the biggest piece of crap I have ever bought after 3 times of using it it has burnt up the head that came with it and now has burnt up the impact head I had for it I'm extremely pissed right now I bought it for my husband for Father's day after his other drill went bad and now he's mad
customer_reviews.author: dana walker

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: I have use this to drive countless screws to secure cement backer board into a wood subfloor. I bought the attachable driver, but it was completely unnecessary. I have also mixed about 8 50 pound bags of thinset mortar. A whole 50 pound bag is too much even with a small mixer attachment. I almost burned out the drill, but stopped before that happened. So I have since only mixed half of the bag at a time and the drill handles it very well. You wont find a better value for the money. The next step up is probably the 200 dollar range.
customer_reviews.author: nowuknow

customer_reviews.title: I had a cordless drill that would not go in ...
customer_reviews.text: I had a cordless drill that would not go in reverse any longer and bought this B&D drill because I also wanted something with a little more power than the cordless drill i had. This drill is not too heavy to hold, but it has the power I needed. I was driving 6" screws into some landscaping timbers with ease with the drill while my cordless model would not always be able to get the entire screw through the material. this Drill also allows for other attachments to be used on it such as a sander or a small circular saw but I have not tried any other attachments on it yet.
customer_reviews.author: K. Cormier

customer_reviews.title: Great value for apartment dwellers, attachments work great; hard to drill/drive in cramped areas
customer_reviews.text: The clutch works great for driving delicate phillps screws without damaging the heads. Also a very good drill, even in sheet steel. The size is a bit on the bulky side, so often it is hard to get into somewhat tight spots and still maintain a straight-on orientation needed for drilling and driving. Still, it is a great value, and the corded power gives much more drilling and attachment power. Works great with Jigsaw attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I have used this a couple of times and it is working great. No problems at all with the drill. However, after I bought it I found out that they make all sorts of attachments to use with it. The drill part snaps off and you just plug in whatever attachment you want to use, There are 1/2 dozen attachments. However, the problem -- I cannot find anywhere to buy the attachments, and specifically the hedge trimmer. Everyplace says it is "Out of Stock" and neither Home Depot, Lowes or Walmart will order it for me
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: BLACK & DECKER BACKS THEIR PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drill one year ago and used it frequently for drilling and sanding using the mouse sander attachment. It is a bit too heavy for me, but the convenience of one tool and smaller attachments makes up for that. A year to the day after purchasing it I wanted to do some sanding but was unable to remove the drill head - it was locked solid. I contacted B&D about the problem and today received an email telling me they were shipping a new unit to me! This is exceptional customer service!!
customer_reviews.author: Kilbarchan

customer_reviews.title: Nice to be able to interchange attachments
customer_reviews.text: This is stronger than my battery operated Matrix, but I still have the problem that sometimes it doesn't drive my screws all the way in the wood, but strips them instead. I do like how you can interchange the attachments, that is a plus. But, sometimes it is hard for me to get the attachment off when I want to change out attachments. But, it's always easy to put attachment on. Just push till it clicks.
customer_reviews.author: Kvinna

customer_reviews.title: Oops 😬
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for me for Christmas after I dropped his Milwaukee drill. 😬 Oops! I suggested we get a inexpensive drill for myself since I do a lot of diy projects. So far it's worked out great. He got a few different attachments for it. The sander and circular saw. The saw is a little difficult to use. My hands are small and the position of the safety button and trigger are almost out of reach. Overall it was a good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: SAME FEEL AS A CORDLESS BUT WAY MORE POWER than an 18 Volt Milwaukee
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! I will probably never buy a battery operated tool again. I was looking for a drill /driver for a while and found this. They put the handle in the middle for superb balance and it has a trigger just like the cordless ones have for great control.. I have not seen any other drill maker who places the handle in the center for balance like this one is. They all put the handle at the rear with all the weight up front making them hard to handle with one hand. This is the tool everyone needs. This will get rid of the need to keep affording overpriced batteries and under powered units the cordless industry makes..
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Great drill to use
customer_reviews.text: More a drill for control, and even better than my old old black and decker gives power when you need it. So far, this is a good solid drill for the money. Used it to pre-drill around 3,000 screws in my wooden fence . Nice variable speed control. The price was so good I actually bought 2 of them thinking the first would burn out, but the first one is still alive and kicking. I guess time will tell if it lasts. It may not be the most powerful drill on the market, but I'm really happy I picked this drill for the job I needed for. Lot's of fun using it.
customer_reviews.author: John T

customer_reviews.title: Simply works.
customer_reviews.text: Needed a replacement for my junker Ryobi's. Got tired of replacing batteries or having them go out in the middle of a days work. This is a decent drill, not too heavy and I do not mind having 100' of extension cord behind me as long as I get my work done. So far it has been used to drive screws into studs for hanging my large format images, drive screws into an aluminum dor to cover the torn screen, take apart a couple of TV's and lawn gear, drill into steel propane tank for a furnace build and has not failed or acted badly. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark A. Henry

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and powerful
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my craftsman bolt-on circular saw attachment, because I love that little saw but sometimes I keep it in one spot and do a lot of cutting so with this drill I don't have to constantly swap batteries and also it's A LOT more powerful than the cordless version. and YES these Black & Decker Matrix drills/attachments are fully compatible with Craftsman Bolt-On so don't hesitate to buy these if you need a replacement for your Craftsman or something.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip Rogalski

customer_reviews.title: Frozen chuck (which I don't even tolarate in a roast)
customer_reviews.text: Wish I could comment on how well the product works. But out of the box, the chuck was frozen to the collar of the chuck assembly. Will be returning to Amazon on their excellent return policy after the crazy Christmas shipping rush is over. It baffles me how Black & Decker's quality control personnel in China can fail to spin test the chuck before loading into the box. I'll have to rely on my 40 year old, U.S. made Black & Decker one-way, one speed drill I inherited from my father-in-law until I find a more reliable new drill.
customer_reviews.author: naturallyinquisitive

customer_reviews.title: Useless and hokey. Chuck locked up, motor clunks and sparks.
customer_reviews.text: Straight out of the box the drill chuck was frozen solid. Could not get it to move at all. Thinking I might be missing something, I looked at the instructions in the box. There was nothing about operating the drill/driver in the instructions. (What do the numbers 1 through 10 around the chuck indicate?) Instructions didn't even acknowledge that a drill/driver was attachment was included, only the "bare power unit." Already deemed useless and an immediate return, but I plugged it in to see how the "unit" works. Wow. The motor made clunking noises and sparked like an old godzilla toy in both forward and reverse modes. Scary, and very disappointing. Don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: YouAskedSo...

customer_reviews.title: No need to mess with batteries!
customer_reviews.text: It is actually difficult to find a corded driver drill and this one is cost effective. I like the fact that it doesn't use rechargeable batteries that are toxic and need special recycling. I also like that there are other attachments that can be applied to the base motor further reducing the need for more waste. It worked just fine for the small workload I had to use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Jason L. Stiles

customer_reviews.title: Sweet Drill
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I wanted a variable speed corded drill for around the house because i would rather fight an extension cord than buy one more battery for my cordless drills. This one is everything i wanted, so far ive only done light work with it but thats about all i ever do. I did drill a few holes in a metal door and it did great but thats about the touchest thing i have tried. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Sweet

customer_reviews.title: No hedge trimming with this, but otherwise a nice, versatile tool.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this corded version of the Matrix because I wanted more power using the hedge trimmer attachment. To my surprise, this drill does not accept the hedge trimmer attachment head. It almost goes in there, but no cigar. I tried everything and it just doesn't work for some reason. Other attachments that I have work fine. Now, if I put this attachment on the cordless model, it fits fine and works great. So, if you are planning on using this corded version for hedge trimming you will be out of luck. You will have to stay with the cordless model which does a good job, but not as much power and the batteries run down quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Wally

customer_reviews.title: Good, but didn't do the job for me out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: This has a beautifully smooth action, but the clutch for driving screws is not tight enough. I would put it on 10 and couldn't sink a BackerOn® screw into a 7/16" Wonderboard on 2x4 studs -- it would slip before completing the job, even at "10". Putting it on "lock" mode doesn't work well either as its too easy to over drive the screws. So I went to the impact driver attachment and that works much better. I still need more time with that attachment to be able to comment meaningfully, but I think if you want to drive screws with any control, you really need the imact driver attachment, especially for phillips head screws.
customer_reviews.author: Chubby Checkers

customer_reviews.title: So So
customer_reviews.text: I like how this is multifunction and wired so it has good consistent power. No need to worry about batteries being charged. However, my drill has developed a sticky trigger recently which is really inconvenient and a potential safety concern. I need to contact the manufacturer about the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew T

customer_reviews.title: Very very satisfied with the Matrix tools.
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely satisfied with all the matrix tools. I purchased the 20volt cordless drill and the electric drill so I can have backup if needed .So far I have the sander /impact /sawzaw /circular saw and jig saw. They all have extreme torque and always finish the job. I could go on forever but I'm going to say get it you won't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: geralddavis

customer_reviews.title: Defective Item/Just Junk
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t even owned it a month(eligible for return through March 4th), and the thing burned up and quit working. I was using a sanding disk to restore the paint on my old 1989 Ford Ranger project, and it suddenly started smoking and the drill attachment started acting up, then it just locked up all together. This is ridiculous and really not worth the $35 I spent.
customer_reviews.author: King1025

customer_reviews.title: Versatile home level power tool system
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for household level repairs and home improvement level maintenance etc... It's also fairly inexpensive. It doesn't replace industrial grade tools, but it's great at saving time around the house. I repaired a interior door hinge that was stripped out. Cut dowels with the mini circular saw, drilled out holes with drill, and drove in the hinge screws with the driver. Never even had to leave the ladder to change tools or bits. Limited use in heavier, "industrial level" tasks, but that's not what it's for.
customer_reviews.author: bdub383

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I mainly bought this because I had nothing and was doing a project that needs multiple tools, I didn’t look up other black and decker tools otherwise I probably would of bought something else sense the attachments are about the price of the dedicated black and decker tool. Either way I’ve used it for small producers here and there for about 2 years and it works great
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Salas

customer_reviews.title: Why I got this drill
customer_reviews.text: This was the only corded drill I could find with a clutch to keep me from burying my screws deeper than I wanted to. I'm totally satisfied with it. My previous drill was just like this one, only it was battery powered and needed a new battery but I couldn't get one because none of the parts were available anymore, so I decided to go corded.
customer_reviews.author: jerry r

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product for the price. I'm sick of expensive dead batteries on cordless drill/drivers, and the price on this drill is incredible for the quality. Bonus points for the fact that I can swap out tool heads if I need to in the future. But even as "just a drill/driver," it's great. Plenty of torque, reasonable length on the cord (but you'll want an extension cord).
customer_reviews.author: Rod P.

customer_reviews.title: I love these matrix drills because there's so many tools In ...
customer_reviews.text: I love these matrix drills because there's so many tools In one. I have already bought three of the battery matrix drills with every accessory they have so I decided to buy a corded matrix drill For a back up in case something happens to my battery operated head I seem to wear them out because i use it so much
customer_reviews.author: Big Mike....NY

customer_reviews.title: pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: perfect handy tool for smaller projects and no need to rely on batteries or worry about going bad. I do suggest an extension cord to buy with it as its short. also its nice to know and interesting that you can buy other pieces and have different tools on hand down the line.
customer_reviews.author: Stiv Kovacic

customer_reviews.title: by far my favorite. almost as much power and torque as the ...
customer_reviews.text: currently own and use 4 drills. a very old corded black and decker that my dad got in the 80's, a cordless black and decker 18V that i got a few years ago, a corded harbor freight drill, and now this. by far my favorite. almost as much power and torque as the old 80's B&D and has the added breakaway feature to control the torque when driving screws like my cordless B&D. also ordered the jigsaw and router attachment, but after using both, i think i will stick to this one as a drill and actually buy a router (already have another jigsaw).
customer_reviews.author: BINOBINOBINO

customer_reviews.title: When you need more power than cordless. Works with Craftsman Bolt accessories too.
customer_reviews.text: I have a cordless craftsman Bolt and a bunch of accessories. To protect this 'investiment', I bought this guy for when I need more power. All the accessories work great on both products! I'd like to have been able to pay less and get it without the drill attachment (I have two now), but at least I can use the two of them with different bits and when one breaks I'll have the other. It is the most useful attachment, after all. The power output is good and it is indeed variable speed. I like how it attaches/releases from the attachments better than the Bolt. Nice!
customer_reviews.author: J. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Trigger Problems at Mid-Point
customer_reviews.text: Bought 3 separate units, to complement the battery-powered sister drill, over a one-year period. Returned two. All have trigger issues, with those produced in 2016 (factory unit 58) even more pronounced. More specifically, variable-speed setting works well up to the mid-point of trigger squeeze; and, then the trigger reaches a sticking or partial-stop point. More trigger pressure then abruptly kicks the drill into full speed, shredding anything you're driving. So, it's essentially a standard; and, easily controlled partial variable-speed drill.....
customer_reviews.author: Back-up Guy

customer_reviews.title: Good if the chuck doesn't seize open
customer_reviews.text: I've owned one of these for 4 years and it has worked very well. Yesterday I was changing bits on the drill attachment, and the chuck became stuck in the fully open position. I ordered a replacement of the same model, and it arrived with the chuck already stuck in the open position. You'll see several other reviews mention this issue spanning several years. I'm sending the new drill back and getting a different dedicated drill. The main motor body still works fine, I'll use it for the other attachments I have (sander, jigsaw, impact driver) but the drill chuck is so questionable I'm not risking it again.
customer_reviews.author: Peter O.

customer_reviews.title: GREAT tool to have!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent tool. I bought it to build deck and I didn't want a cordless impact driver/drill because... well, I hate them. So this is one of the few compact style impact drivers even available these days but with the added benefit of switching between drill and driver! This worked great and driving in the 3" deck screws but you need to be careful or set the clutch or it will drive the screw clear through the 2x6. It also had no problems driving (pre-drilled) 3/8" x 6" lags into 4x4 posts. I haven't purchased the other add-ons (saws, etc) yet but the drill and impact driver are awesome and have put up with some abuse so far.
customer_reviews.author: aolshove

customer_reviews.title: The best idea for general home improvements/projects.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome and powerful drill/motor unit for the matrix system. I am not a professional but use tools more often than the average around the house for various projects. I hate dead batteries so I bought this plug in version. I bought the drill, circular saw and jig saw attachments and can't be happier. I'm going to complete the set with the impact and oscillating tool because this is a great system. I already own a mouse sander so I'm not going to buy that attachment but I'm sure that would work as well as the others. If you but this you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim T

customer_reviews.title: I love love love my B&D drill!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I got the corded version of this drill. Never having to worry about running out of juice or having to wait overnight to finish a project is great. And I thought I got the AC drill to save money. Turns out to be much more convenient. And I absolutely love the extra functionality of the matrix drill. So far I only have the additional jigsaw attachment. But how cool is that? In 5 seconds my drill turns into a jigsaw.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee Beth

customer_reviews.title: lots of power
customer_reviews.text: Great drill but I could not use to repair a table. My table has a bottom shelf and I had to repair the bottom of the top shelf. The length of the drill from drill point to back so when it is vertical to drill, it doesn't fit under the table. I would never have even thought to wonder about that. So, if you have a tight space to drill, this drill is too long. But a great drill anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Blue

customer_reviews.title: and the clutch is a nice touch if I ever have to use it to ...
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I expect in a drill. Lots of power, the spindle is straight, and trigger is variable speed, and the clutch is a nice touch if I ever have to use it to drive screws. First day i had it, I chucked up a 1/4" drill bit, and used my dial indicator to check for wobble in the chuck, barely any registered, not enough to be notice in my work. Since I have had it, I have drilled about 3 dozen holes or more and this drill is doing an amazing job.
customer_reviews.author: C n C Computers

customer_reviews.title: A bit too heavy for me to handle
customer_reviews.text: But it certainly did what I wanted! I like that it is electric. The last drill I had was battery run so nowI don't have to worry about my drill running out of "power" BTW! I am a 73 year old grandmother so if I can use it anyone should!
customer_reviews.author: Jenielf

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill
customer_reviews.text: I love Black & Decker products and this one works great. It always works and it is very durable
customer_reviews.author: Laura Baldwin

customer_reviews.title: Great multi-purpose tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as well as the trim saw attachment to cover the entire underside of my carport with OSB. I was worried only being a 4 amp drill it would not have enough power to cut. As soon as began cutting/drilling, I found this AC-powered matrix system had plenty of power. Cut through sheet after sheet after sheet of 1/2" OSB as well as any other purpose built circular saw I've used (I used to build sets for plays, some quite elaborate.) Very satisfied with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: It's not the best drill out there but for the price and being ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not the best drill out there but for the price and being able to attach different power tools saves space. It does heat up pretty fast but hasn't failed on me yet. I prefer the corded over the cordless since I don't have to worry about losing charge in the middle of the project.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for any home improvement project!
customer_reviews.text: This drill did the trick! My husband and I needed a drill to do home improvement projects and my old battery powered drill wasn’t doing it (with the constant breaks for recharging). My husband was able to get more done in less time. Just what the engineer ordered.
customer_reviews.author: Miaesha Blackwell

customer_reviews.title: Chuck is stuck wide open
customer_reviews.text: Drill arrived and the chuck was stuck wide open. I tried putting the collar into a vice to get it unstuck, but it wouldn't budge. Contacting the manufacturer now. I would avoid this product. Even a drill from Harbor Freight is better than this. Terrible quality control. See other reviews, same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Kevo

customer_reviews.title: Awesome impact!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first impact drill and man does this thing have some power. I wasn't sure if I wanted to get black and decker but I'm glad I did. Really holds up and great to use around the house for new projects. A+ seller and product.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Radford

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful for the price!
customer_reviews.text: When I bought the Black and Decker Matrix, I somewhat expected a performance akin to the usual B & D low end device. Was I surprised! It actually works better than the Rigid at about half the price. I have collected all of the accessories and am especially pleased with the circular saw and impact drill attachments. The other attachments work well also. I do not expect miracles from this device but for the price they are great. The ergonomics are also very good from a user perspective. The battery life is also very good. Black and Decker has a winner here so here is hoping they don't screw it up with a short life cycle as they usually do.
customer_reviews.author: donesp

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for little projects around the house
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for little projects around the house. Disclaimer: I am a bit of an interchangeable tool nerd. I just think it's cool to be able to have one motor and drill and saw and trim and etc. I just wish I would have gotten the high voltage battery version (there are 2 battery versions and a corded) which actually has higher power than the corded version.
customer_reviews.author: Miles W

customer_reviews.title: Best choice for me
customer_reviews.text: Already own the 20V Matrix Cordless drill but at times need the power of corded drill, my 23 year old corded drill gave out and I needed a new one. Since I already own many of the Matrix attachments I figured this would be my best bet, and I was right. 4amps is plenty of power for my needs and this works great with all my other attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Great all rounder.
customer_reviews.text: Great machine! It does drilling out wood screws just as good as it does drilling in wood. I only had wanted the machine to have a higher RPM, for smaller drills. And another head that converts the higher RPM to a lower RPM, and more torque. You see, it's a great all rounder, But this kind of device needs a faster rotating drill, and a head specifically designed for higher torque screws and bolts. Since it doesn't have this, it does either one of them mildly ok.
customer_reviews.author: H B

customer_reviews.title: B&D Matrix drill, great drills for great value.
customer_reviews.text: This drill has more rpms than the 20 volt matrix. I have three 20 Volt Matrix and five attachments in my tool box at work. I am an industrial electrician. These drills have stood up to the test for 5 years now.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: I love this tool
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. I use this tool in 200v (with transformer 220 to 110 and 550W) in my carpetery projects. With wire is more powerfull, comparing to wireless tool and very silent comparing with another drill tools; ergonomic, very useful in home. The wire is not problem for mi, is a only purchase, because i prefer the wire to still buying batteries!
customer_reviews.author: andres

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Did start smoking the first day I used it. Had to disassemble, clean up, and reassemble, but since then, I've ran this tool with 90% of the matrix attachments on long building days and it holds up like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Matthewannette

customer_reviews.title: I'm interested in getting some of the other heads for some of my other projects as well since it's a cool feature, but I may end
customer_reviews.text: I needed a drill for a few small projects in my new place but I didn't want anything very fancy or crazy expensive. This drill has handled everything I've thrown at it so far (holes in sheetrock, wood, screwing things in) and it didn't break the bank. I'm interested in getting some of the other heads for some of my other projects as well since it's a cool feature, but I may end up just getting a dedicated piece of equipment instead. I would highly recommend for anyone doing basic projects but wants something reliable.
customer_reviews.author: monkeychef

customer_reviews.title: Handy and great
customer_reviews.text: Works great not so heavy but doesn't go through cement which I needed for a project I was doing. I'm new to using these drill so excuse my lack of knowledge. I love that it's corded and ready to go whenever needed. But all my other projects in my home I've been able to use including my pallets. I would Def recommend having one of these around the house. It makes my life alot easier and I've been able to use it on everything except the cement walk outside on my back porch :)
customer_reviews.author: prduquesa

customer_reviews.title: heavy duty small drill
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a light weight simple drill. This drill is not light by any means but seems to be a very good drill. Time will tell but it will probably outlive me.
customer_reviews.author: B Starcher

customer_reviews.title: nice little drill with lots of useful attachments (purchased separately, of course)
customer_reviews.text: It's a handy little drill, and when combined with the other attachments it becomes a nice swiss army knife-like device. However, I can't emphasize enough what other reviewers have said: don't use it for high torque applications, because it will burn out quickly. I burned mine out drilling a 4" hole with a hole saw, while not really pushing it very hard. Still, I like it (and its attachments) enough that I bought a replacement -- but I won't be using for anything other than light duty.
customer_reviews.author: Ion Badulescu

customer_reviews.title: Great, cheap drill
customer_reviews.text: Feels really solid in hand- has a nice heaviness, but it's not massive like my older drill. I used it to assemble IKEA furniture, and it was more than equal to the task. I feel like I could probably do medium duty work with this drill, and I won't have to worry about the battery fading with age :). So, as far as the Matrix features go, I haven't exchanged the front module. I probably never will. BUT, the drill module is super-solidly affixed, so that the Matrix feature doesn't make it any less effective as a drill.
customer_reviews.author: KM

customer_reviews.title: Own the Cordless Too
customer_reviews.text: I already own the cordless (battery) version of this drill so I can honestly say I really like this multi-functional tool. I was very skeptical when I was first considering the cordless purchase, but after using it, I found it to be an excellent purchase that came in handy on a multitude of occasions. This is not a tool for professional use but rather it's for the average fixer upper/handy person and it's a great addition to your collection. I bought the power cord version because I'll always use power first if that's possible.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome drills!
customer_reviews.text: These Matrix drills are hands down the best drills I have ever owned. I absolutely love them...and I do a LOT of construction projects on our property. I have both the corded version and the battery version, and I also bought the router attachment. If you are going to use the router attachment (or probably any of the attachments), you will want to get the corded version of this drill, as the battery version will run down in about 10 minutes of steady use. But so what. For the price...you cannot compare to what these drills can do. They are lightweight, powerful, durable, and I appreciate them every time I use them.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Very good item so satisfied for the price !!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, it marvelous really guys well quality especially for the price. Torque is quite enough for daily use. Universal head for every drill/screwdriver bit set. So easy to use. If you use this in another country like european i mean different plug then you should buy seven star 500watt step down converter, i tried even torque setting is 10 there is no problem at all. It works max 460 watt... Dont afraid to buy for another european country , mark my words and listen carefully. You can use everything for :):)
customer_reviews.author: EngineerMurat

customer_reviews.title: Works well; not noisy
customer_reviews.text: Somehow quieter than a few other similar tools from other brands that I tried, both the motor and the chuck. Reasonable speed control via the trigger pressure. Best of all, it's Matrix; I bought a jigsaw attachment elsewhere, and it attached and worked without any problems.
customer_reviews.author: Dmitry Cheryasov

customer_reviews.title: Great drill.
customer_reviews.text: I had a crap $10 Black and Decker battery drill from walmart before this one. This thing drills like butter. Couldn't ask for better. Got a dewalt drill set on sale at lowes to go with it for $10. I have everything I need for basic house tasks now! Plan on getting the sander attachment and possibly the saw attachment to go with them as well. It's not super heavy (but not ultralight either) and it isn't overly massive.
customer_reviews.author: Kiyonai

customer_reviews.title: Great to have a Corded Drill!
customer_reviews.text: It's so nice to have a drill with a cord! I don't use a drill often so every time our cordless drill was needed we had to wait for hours for it to charge. This one is lightweight and does everything I need for light household repairs. I plan to buy some of the accessories.
customer_reviews.author: Indo Traveler

customer_reviews.title: Black and Decker Lightweight drill has lightweight power
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't buy this again or give it to a friend. The charge lasted all of five minutes before the drill faltered and I had to get out my Ryobi to finish the job. Not worth the price at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Gordon Swinnerton

customer_reviews.title: This is a good deal.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this working inside and out in the cold and have used it on some 4 in deck screws and it has held up and works really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Powerful
customer_reviews.text: Great drill. Tons of torque. Good drill for home use because it is more powerful than the average cordless drill and you won’t have to bother with an extension cord 90% of the time. Plus the batteries don’t wear out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vroom Vroom
customer_reviews.text: I really like this drill. Just works. I have yet to buy any of the addons, but will be buying those in the future. Only complaint is cable is a bit short, but i use with a 50 foot power line, so didn't really think it was worth knocking a star. kinda figure all of them now have short cables these days.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Great plug in drill. Every woman should have one.
customer_reviews.text: It's a great drill for home use. I used it to easily put up some shelves. The manufacture box is large enough to hold all the bits and screws and level I've accumulated too, so impromptu tool box!.
customer_reviews.author: NicoleP

customer_reviews.title: The black and decker matrix series is amazing. I am a contractor
customer_reviews.text: The black and decker matrix series is amazing. I am a contractor, and I use this, and the battery version every day. I can grab my bag of matrix tools, and do almost anything. Certainly some jobs call for bigger tools, but I find that 90% of the time they stay in the truck, because this will do most of it. This has plenty of torque for most small - medium jobs. It is not as nice as a Dewalt, but I the convenience, and portability are well worth the sacrifice. The fact that you can interchange the craftsman version too, gives this even more uses.
customer_reviews.author: Chase

customer_reviews.title: Great backup
customer_reviews.text: This is a great back up for the cordless version. Having an extra chuck is nice to to quickly swap between drilling and driving.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Langner

customer_reviews.title: Very handy tool
customer_reviews.text: Every woman should have one of these in her toolbox! If you work around your house fixing little or big things, or doing small home improvement projects, this is a very versatile tool to have in your repertoire! The Matrix interchangeable tools are very easy to put on and remove, and I haven't found one that doesn't work well. This was a very worth while purchase, and I find myself using it very frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy top performance tool
customer_reviews.text: I use this product for my self. When I say it can do lots of work, that's first hand experience. I'm not disappointed with this tool. It's light wright and easy to manoeuvre.
customer_reviews.author: jb66

customer_reviews.title: If your just assembling things like closets, tables
customer_reviews.text: Dont expect too much from it. If your just assembling things like closets, tables,etc or your just installing things to the wall it will be fine. You will not be satisfied if you are looking for something for professional use, in which case just buy a $500-1000 dewalt set and dont worry about it for 2+ years.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed

After a few hours it's fine again, but then restarts... but it works... Good cheap drill/driver
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you are not a PRO and just need a drill in your house - this is good inexpensive choice.
customer_reviews.text: Great everyday drill. Maybe not a super pro, but works great for most simple tasks. Gives you more power compare with the battery frills\screwdrivers. Drills wood, soft metal - no problem. Cleaning/sanding - no problem. The build quality and the ergonomic is solid. If you are not a PRO and just need a drill in your house - this is good inexpensive choice. Looking forward for buying different tool attachments.
customer_reviews.author: Vladislav Aksenov

customer_reviews.title: Don’t stop you project when your batteries do
customer_reviews.text: The matrix is great as a cordless. But this corded device helps you go limitlessly after your 2 batteries are consumed. If you have a ton of matrix attachments, consider adding this to your tool bag as you don’t want your project to end when your batteries do.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck N

customer_reviews.title: It seems to provide a lot of power BUT the ...
customer_reviews.text: It seems to provide a lot of power BUT the chunk can be a tad loose. I'm not sure why. I may just be failing to tighten the chuck. I will have to give the drill a few more days to see if it's worth keeping or exchanging (if it turns out my chuck is malfunctioning) On the more positive note, the chord is amazingly convenient. Won't have to worry about replacing heavy AND expensive batteries.
customer_reviews.author: KYROS

customer_reviews.title: Works great and is very powerful
customer_reviews.text: As a casual user of this drill, it made sense to spend a lot less money to get the wired version. I have used it to make custom fitted shelves for my chinchilla cages. Works great and is very powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Edward J Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: Killer power, build seems solid, gobs of power.
customer_reviews.text: New to this drill but so far so good- The trigger is a little twitchy in that the power comes on VERY early compared to my battery powered drills but it feels like a BEAST compared to them so I'm stoked. Even with the interchangeable head, which I thought would compromise power, it's better than my 24v so I'm sold. Looking forward to trying some of the available attachments *if* I ever actually have a need for them.
customer_reviews.author: desotod

customer_reviews.title: Great first drill
customer_reviews.text: Great first drill. I wish I could sink drill bits into it a little deeper to make repetitive steps quicker (instead of using painters tape for shallow sections of wood). If countersinking a bunch of screws the drill would get warm to the touch so I'd have to let it cool. This only happened a couple times during a large project though. I loved how easy it was to change the bits.
customer_reviews.author: vjandlittleone

customer_reviews.title: 4 amps really is not enough.
customer_reviews.text: Not very powerful. I didn't see that it was only 4 amps anywhere on Amazon's page for it. You get what you pay for, but I do not see a use for a drill, saw, sander, or pretty much anything it does at such low amps. I have the sander attachment, and am not impressed.

customer_reviews.author: T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: I got this to go along with some of my ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this to go along with some of my other B & D Matrix tools and really bought it for more of having the ability to use the cord if my batteries die. I don't have any complaints about this. I assembled a bunch of IKEA furniture with it for a weekend and ran into no problems. Ample power for home use and is reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: A good basic drill with possibilities
customer_reviews.text: A moderately powerful drill, not as strong as the 6 amp one I replaced, but strong enough. It works to mix tile mortar and grout that the 6 amp drill did easily, but hopefully I will not have much more of that to do. While I like the idea of replaceable heads, I find it difficult to remove the head (age and arthritis). I do like the variable power drive that will not twist my arm off as the 6 amp one could. I have not yet used the hammer driver adaptor.
customer_reviews.author: bill peters

customer_reviews.title: Great drill.. and whatever else you need it to be!
customer_reviews.text: I can't say enough about this drill. After losing the battery capacity on several different brands of power tools, I decided I was going corded. The swappable nature of the base is amazing and I've purchased several of the other accessories. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: NA in L.A.

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for Craftsmen drill and accessories.
customer_reviews.text: Good price. Replaced Craftsmen battery drill. Also purchased B&D battery drill so I could use my accessories.
customer_reviews.author: RJZ

customer_reviews.title: Battery driven power tools are wonderful things right up to the point that the battery ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this drill to make sure I'm able to use all the 'Matrix' components I've acquired when the battery on the base assembly dies. Battery driven power tools are wonderful things right up to the point that the battery no longer holds a charge and become useless, hence making all the attachments useless too. Between the life of the battery (normally 2 years) and the cost of a new battery ($60.00 plus) the Matrix AC Drill/Driver is a good investment at $69.00.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan W. Braun

customer_reviews.title: and I was able to drill into masonry very easily. I love the multi-use attachment option

Using it for a prolong period of time definitely made it hard to work with the drill as it was hot to the touch. The hammer drill attachment I used did what I needed well though, and I was able to drill into masonry very easily. I love the multi-use attachment option.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Drill
customer_reviews.text: I love this drill and accessory system. I had a cordless before and decided to get this for uniformity. It works great. All the attachment interchange easily. the drill and accessories work flawlessly. Its just a great drill too, I had to use it over the weekend and drilled probably about 600 screws within 2 days, most the first day, and it never let up. Couldn't be happier, especially for the price.

customer_reviews.title: Great drill
customer_reviews.text: Great drill, I’ve had it for a couple years now and I’ve only bogged it down once.

customer_reviews.text: Maybe I don't know how to properly use an electric drill, but I would highly recommend taking care to cover the trigger area so that it can't get stuck from all the dust falling in!! Otherwise, pretty cool drill, I would rather store bits instead of changing the front module though
